name: Creamy Polenta
description: Like mashed potatoes’ cornmeal cousin, this cozy, comforting side dish is perfect to serve up in the winter months. Kid-approved and hassle-free, this creamy polenta dish doesn’t require endless, stovetop stirring. Serve it alongside roasted chicken and sautéed veggies.
preparation: In Round Steamer, combine mix, water, and 1 cup milk. Cover and microwave on high 5 min.
Remove from microwave (use caution when handling steamer—it will be hot!) and whisk well to break up lumps. Whisk in remaining 1 cup milk and butter.
Microwave, uncovered, on high 10 min, whisking halfway through. Let stand in microwave 5 min. Whisk before serving.
tips: No Steamer? Make polenta on the stovetop! In a large pot over medium heat, combine mix, 2 cups each water and milk, and 1 tbsp butter. Stir constantly until thickened, about 35–40 min. Whisk before serving.
Have some fun with stir-ins! Try shaved Parmesan cheese, cracked black pepper, herbs like parsley and thyme, sundried tomatoes, black olives, or pesto sauce.
